title: Xi and Putin Bind China and Russia’s Economies Further, Despite War in Ukraine
description: On the second day of the Chinese leader’s state visit in Moscow, Xi Jinping and Vladimir V. Putin declared an enduring economic partnership, in an effort to insulate their countries from punitive Western measures.

title: Ukrainian Soldiers Speed Through U.S. Training on Patriot Missiles
description: At the end of a 10-week crash course at a U.S. Army base in Oklahoma, the Ukrainians are essentially running their own training in preparation for the front lines.

title: Pulling the Plug on TikTok Will Be Harder Than It Looks
description: The tensions over the Chinese-owned social media app will come to a head on Thursday, when the company’s chief executive testifies on Capitol Hill.

title: Report of Wuhan Market Samples Found Covid and Animal Mixtures
description: In a much-anticipated study, experts described a swab that contained loads of genetic material from the coronavirus and raccoon dogs.

title: A ‘Rocking Chair Rebellion’: Seniors Call On Banks to Dump Big Oil
description: Older climate activists gathered in cities around the country for a day of action targeting banks that finance fossil fuel projects.

title: Here Is What Putin and Xi Agreed to During Their Moscow Meeting
description: The two leaders did not reveal any progress toward achieving peace in Ukraine.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: China, Japan Divided on Ukraine
description: Also, an I.M.F. loan to Sri Lanka and the Japan-U.S. final in the World Baseball Classic.

title: Macron Appears Ready to Tough Out France’s Pension Crisis
description: Amid protests in the streets and in Parliament, the French leader shows no sign of scrapping a law that raises the retirement age.

title: U.S. Plans to Send Abrams Tanks to Ukraine Far Sooner Than Expected
description: Excess M1A1 tank “hulls” are to be refitted and refurbished to make them ready on a quicker timeline for Ukraine than new tanks could be delivered.

title: Its Forces Under Siege, Ukraine Hits Distant, Russian-Held Crimea
description: The Crimean Peninsula, which Russia seized in 2014, has been a staging ground for other attacks and an increasingly attractive target for Ukraine.

title: Israel Votes to Scrap Law Barring Settlers at Four Evacuated West Bank Sites
description: In a highly symbolic action for Israel’s settler movement, lawmakers approved a first step toward resettling evacuated areas amid spiraling Israeli-Palestinian tensions.

title: A Massive Trump Painting Is Mysteriously Missing
description: A portrait of former President Donald J. Trump by a Salvadoran painter is one of several gifts to the presidential family that is now unaccounted for.

title: Boris Johnson Admits Misleading U.K. Parliament Over Lockdown Parties
description: Former Prime Minister Boris Johnson of Britain, who will testify before a committee investigating whether he lied to lawmakers, said any misinformation was not intentional.

title: Justice Dept. Embraces Supporting Role in Pursuing War Crimes in Ukraine
description: Prosecutors are investigating war crimes against Americans but are mainly focused on helping Ukraine to hold Russians accountable for atrocities.

title: Live Updates: As Xi and Putin Resume Talks, Japan’s Leader Visits Ukraine
description: China’s leader, Xi Jinping, said he had invited President Putin to Beijing, underlining his support on the second day of his state visit to Moscow.

title: Saudi Arabia Frees Saad Almadi, U.S. Dual Citizen Jailed for Dissent
description: Saad Almadi, 72, a Florida resident, was one of several Americans and hundreds of Saudis caught up in the crackdown under Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman. He still cannot fly home, his son said.

title: Macron Plots Next Move After Bitter Victory in Pensions Dispute
description: The future of President Emmanuel Macron’s second term was unclear after a no-confidence vote triggered by his effort to raise France’s retirement age fell short by only nine votes.

title: A Translation Problem
description: A small change to climate science could make a big difference for Americans.

title: British Woman Finishes 10-Year Survey of National Trust Scones
description: A Londoner spent 10 years sampling scones at hundreds of historic sites across the U.K. Here’s why her story made headlines — and which essential topping she says should come before the other.

title: As War in Ukraine Grinds on, China Helps Refill Russian Drone Supplies
description: China has shipped more than $12 million in drones to Russia since it invaded Ukraine, in an indication of quiet collaboration between the two.

title: Ukraine Says Explosion in Crimea Destroyed Russian Cruise Missiles
description: Kremlin-appointed authorities in Crimea denied the claim, saying that drones had not struck military targets and instead hit “aimed at civilian objects.”

title: Report Finds London Police Force Is Sexist and Racist
description: The report, ordered up after the murder of Sarah Everard by a London police officer in 2021, denounced the culture within Britain’s largest police force and called for change.

title: The Head Spinning Reality of Venezuela’s Economy
description: After years of extreme scarcity, some Venezuelans lead lives of luxury as others scrape by. The nation of grinding scarcity has increasingly become one of haves and have-nots.

title: Following a Folk Tale Through the Himalayas
description: On a trip through northern India, a writer was guided by the age-old epic story of “Rajula Malushahi,” which led him to a series of unexpected places.

title: Japan’s Prime Minister Becomes Last G7 Leader to Visit Ukraine
description: Fumio Kishida, who has been seeking a more active role for his country in international affairs, made an unannounced trip to meet with Ukraine’s president.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Xi Jinping’s visit to Moscow.
